title: NH Drug Felon, Considered ‘Violent,’ Could Be In The North Country Or Lakes Region, Corrections Says
description: Officials are searching for Hailey Ramsey, who is wanted on a probation violation, as well as drug possession and transportation charges.
content:
Hailey F. Ramsey is 23, white, about 4 feet, 11 inches tall, and weighs around 100 pounds. She has brown eyes and dirty blonde strawberry hair. Ramsey has no known aliases, marks, or tattoos. A warrant for her arrest was issued on July 8.

Ramsey was sentenced to probation in December 2023 on drug charges in Coos County Superior Court. “Ramsey has absconded from supervision multiple times after each arrest in defiance of her specific bail conditions,” an alert stated. “Ramsey has a history of aggressive-defiant behavior towards authority to include resisting arrest.”

Ramsey was most recently arrested in Laconia in mid-April. She is known to frequent Lakes Region and North Country communities. Editor's note: This post was derived from information supplied by the New Hampshire Department of Corrections and does not indicate a conviction. This link explains the process for requesting the removal of a name from New Hampshire Patch police reports.

According to superior court records, Hailey was accused of witness tampering in January 2023 in Berlin. She was indicted two months later. After failing to appear at an arraignment and bail hearing, a warrant was issued for her arrest. After appearing, she failed to attend a dispositional conference in July 2023. Ramsey was also charged with drug possession and resisting arrest or detention after an incident in Berlin. After being caught again, she was given cash bail. Ramsey failed to appear again in September 2023 and was later given $5,000 cash bail. In December 2023, Ramsey agreed to a plea deal for a lesser charge, obstructing government administration, and received a 12-month sentence with 90 days of time served credit. The tampering charge was then nolle prossed. She also pleaded guilty to the drug and resisting charges and received two 12-month sentences and $868 in fines, all suspended for three years. Ramsey was accused of violating probation in May 2024 and failed to appear at a hearing on July 8.

In February, she was indicted on drug possession and transport of drugs after an incident in Berlin in June 2023. Ramsey failed to appear at the arraignment and bail hearing on March 11. A motion hearing was held on April 7, but she failed to appear again at a dispositional conference on July 7. Ramsey is due back at probation violation and dispositional conference hearings on Sept. 8. If you know where Ramsey is or have seen anyone who resembles her, do not attempt to apprehend her. Contact local police, corrections at 603-271-1804, or the Coos County Sheriff’s Department at 603-788-5598 Do you have a news tip? Please email it to tony.schinella@patch.com. View videos on Tony Schinella's YouTube or Rumble channels. Patch in New Hampshire is now in 190 communities. Also, follow Patch on Google Discover.
summary: Hailey F. Ramsey, a 23-year-old drug offender, could be located in the North Country or Lakes Region of New Hampshire. A warrant for her arrest was issued on July 8. Ramsey was sentenced to probation in December 2023 on drug charges and has a history of absconding from supervision multiple times. She has been accused of witness tampering in January 2023 and was indicted two months later. She also pleaded guilty to drug and resisting charges and received two 12-month sentences and $868 in fines, all suspended for three years. If you know where Ramsey is or have seen anyone resembling her, contact the New Hampshire Department of Corrections.
shortSummary: Hailey F. Ramsey, a violent drug offender with a history of absconding, is on the run from authorities in New Hampshire.

Innan du fortsätter till YouTube
Vi använder cookies och data för att
- leverera och underhålla Googles tjänster
- spåra avbrott och skydda mot spam, bedrägeri och otillåten användning
- mäta målgruppsengagemang och webbplatsstatistik så att vi kan analysera hur våra tjänster används och förbättra tjänsternas kvalitet.
Om du väljer knappen Godkänn alla använder vi även cookies och data för att
- utveckla och förbättra nya tjänster
- leverera annonser och mäta hur effektiva de är
- visa anpassat innehåll utifrån dina inställningar
- visa anpassade annonser utifrån dina inställningar
Om du väljer knappen Avvisa alla använder vi inte cookies i dessa ytterligare syften.
Innehåll och annonser utan anpassning påverkas bland annat av vad du tittar på för tillfället och din plats (annonser visas utifrån din ungefärliga plats). Innehåll och annonser med anpassning kan även omfatta sådant som videorekommendationer, en anpassad YouTube Hem-sida och anpassade annonser utifrån tidigare aktivitet, till exempel vad du tittar på och söker efter på YouTube. Vi använder även cookies och data för att anpassa upplevelsen efter lämplighet för din målgrupp, om tillämpligt.
Välj knappen Fler alternativ för mer information, till exempel om hur du hanterar dina integritetsinställningar. Du kan även besöka g.co/privacytools när som helst.

Community Corner
How To Get Your Name Off A NH Patch Arrest Or Indictment Report
If you've been arrested, convicte, or had your info published on a New Hampshire Patch site, here's what you need to know and do to move on.
Here at the New Hampshire Patch network, we report on many arrests, indictments, and crime incidents in various communities in the Granite State.
However, we also understand that not everyone is convicted of the crimes they allegedly committed. Others have agreed to pleas or have been found not guilty, served their time, and want to move on with their lives. Part of that process is removing your name from the Patch arrest log.
The processes are the same for everyone and are based on a similar method as an arrest annulment in the state of New Hampshire. The removal request requires court paperwork, ideally, the Case Summary document, which shows the charges are completely resolved.
Find out what's happening in Concordfor free with the latest updates from Patch.
Send an in-focus photo or a PDF with all the information to tony.schinella@patch.com or arrestreports@patch.com.
Court documents should show the resolution of the case, along with dates and sentencing information. If your case has been placed on hold without a finding, it is not resolved until the end of that time period when the case is closed. If you have a probationary period at the end of the sentencing or were given a suspended sentence for a certain period of time, the case has not been resolved. Please don't contact us about the removal of arrest information until the case has been completely resolved.
Find out what's happening in Concordfor free with the latest updates from Patch.
It is important to remember this is a courtesy and not a given in every case.

Officials are searching for Hailey Ramsey, who is wanted on a probation violation, as well as drug possession and transportation charges.
Loudon man arrested on domestic charge; Hillsboro woman faces child endangerment, drug charges; teen charged with deadly weapon threat.
Two men were reportedly fighting at a bus depot located near the intersection of North Main and Park streets on Wednesday afternoon.
Concord woman, Sutton man charged with child endangerment; elderly man faces protective order charges twice in 8 hours; warrant arrests.
Plus: Concord woman accused of shooting at Henniker cops; homeless man faces multiple Pembroke arson charges; Hooksett drug indictments.
Eric Sweeney, accused of killing his sister-in-law and two of his nephews 3 years ago, has filed paperwork to change his plea to guilty.
Update: Firefighters from 3 counties spent hours bringing the fire under control Monday; a resident reported hearing explosions in the area.
Plus: State police participate in National Night Out; blotters around the state.
David Paul Hamilton was last seen in the Calvary Cemetery in Concord, getting picked up by the driver of a black pickup Saturday night.
The man described as in his fifties was wearing a hat with the words "Don't Tread On Me" when he tried to force his way into the facility.
Boscawen man faces distribution charge; Warner man faces strangulation indictments; incarcerated stalker indicted on new stalking charge.
Jaykumar Jayantibhai Raval of Flushing was arrested last month, accused of being driven to the South End to pick up gold for “White Devil.”
Carlye Janae Bubacz was wanted on a probation violation and active warrants. She was found and arrested Tuesday in Salisbury, Massachusetts.
Woman accused of false fire alarms at new apartment building; Concord woman, Nashua and Saugus men arrested on domestic violence charges.
Cory Silvano Nickerson of Manchester is considered “armed and dangerous” with “violent tendencies”; he has ties to Massachusetts, Cape Cod.
More campers cited, this time, at the Friendly Kitchen; man with priors charged with prowling at city garage; man charged with deception.
Hopkinton man accused of firing gun inside home; Henniker man indicted on strangulation charge; Franklin felon indicted on stabbing charges.
Stacey Young was arrested on drug, other charges last month; in June, she was accused of being found naked in a car with a guy and drugs.
Connecticut man dies in I-93 crash; man found dead near Isles of Shoals identified; blotters from around the state.
The 42-year-old woman was transported to Androscoggin Valley Hospital and then flown to Massachusetts General Hospital for treatment
Plus: Concord stalker indicted on more stalking charges; Salem man indicted on 13 anti-theft/title penalties; habitual offenders indicted.
Andover, Franklin women arrested on willful concealment charges; Concord, Franklin men face domestic violence charges; mischief arrest.
Xueying Weng was charged with sexual and simple assault; Suhua Tang faces a prostitution charge. Both were held on preventative detention.
Wanted Again: Corrections and the Belknap County Sheriff’s Department are asking for the public’s help in finding Ryan Michael Decato.
Plus: Man arrested on threat and bail charges; man from Maine faces mischief, violations on North Main Street; criminal trespass at Walmart.
Stephanie Lane, 35, of Barnstead, allegedly fled from police; however, a state police plane was overhead following her until she crashed.
Update: Law enforcement was at the Oriental Bodywork Spa, located on North State Street in Concord, for several hours on Wednesday.
Plymouth man accused of distributing drugs; Chichester man indicted on reckless conduct charges after cop chase; thief faces theft charges.
Police say Schleiden Meneide assaulted a woman and threatened to kill her child with a shotgun. He was found in a Waltham hotel on Monday.
Plus: Blotters from around the Granite State.
Christopher Plaisted-Comeau, a felon with a lengthy criminal history, was arrested July 18 after being accused of robbery in late May.
Around 100 gallons of milk spilled at the plant on North State Street in Concord on Monday afternoon.
Man indicted for drug sales; Weare man indicted on burglary at closed mall; East Boston man indicted on Allenstown fraudulent check charge.
Concord cops, firefighters, and EMTs were sent to a Centre Street mental health call Friday afternoon. One woman was taken to the hospital.
Patrick Joseph Michael Wiley was first arrested on assault charges and then charged with stalking and breach of bail earlier this month.
Felony theft charges at JCPenney; perp with priors faces prowling, other charges; man from Indiana arrested on trespass, disorderly charges.
Austin Holton of East Side Drive in Concord will spend several years in prison after targeting underage girls in Indiana, Montana in 2024.
Timothy Joe Burnett is considered “armed and dangerous” due to violence, gang affiliations, and a criminal history dating back 20 years.
Pitman Street mischief, assault; MA woman accused of revocation, disobeying officer; Loudon woman faces Westbourne Road disorderly charge.
Plus: Man indicted on Canterbury child sexual solicitation charges; Franklin man faces gun threat charges; felon indicted on knife charge.

Get The Latest Local News (For Free!) With One Quick Tap
Stay connected locally by following Patch on Google Discover.
Stay on top of local news updates in your community by following Patch on Google Discover!
Google Discover is a curated feed that appears on the Google app and some Android home screens, showcasing new stories and information.
By following Patch, you'll personalize your Google Discover feed to see the latest news on the latest local events and happenings in your town.
Find out what's happening in Across Americafor free with the latest updates from Patch.
To follow Patch, follow these simple steps:
Open Chrome on your phone or tablet. Go to Patch.com or any article on Patch and tap the three-dot menu in the bottom-right corner:
From there, select “Follow patch.com"
Once you follow Patch, you'll see new local content more frequently in your Discover feed, helping you stay on top of the latest headlines from around the neighborhood.
Find out what's happening in Across Americafor free with the latest updates from Patch.
Following Patch will ensure you're not missing out on the latest news — stay up-to-date on everything from weather to the best new local dining spots!

argos_summary: Hailey F. Ramsey, a 23-year-old woman, is wanted for probation violations and drug-related charges after repeatedly failing to appear in court. She has a history of aggressive behavior towards law enforcement and has absconded from supervision multiple times. A warrant for her arrest was issued on July 8, 2024, following her failure to attend a probation violation hearing.
